title: Intellectual Property Training
description: Early stage innovators often misunderstand Intellectual Property or Intangible Assets. This results in under use of innovator IP/IA.

f6_assessments.q0: Whilst this covers an important topic, its not clear that taking essentially the entire challenge budget to train and audit 10 teams is the best use of catalyst fund. On a per proposer basis it is quite expensive relative to the size of many funding requests and there are no economies of scale. Perhaps the proposers could create an online course covering the basics for a lower rate that early stage entrepreneurs could access. Once their business models are up and running and they have revenue streams and capital they could then afford a more bespoke and expensive service.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers are in the business of providing exactly this service thus there is not reason to believe they would not deliver on the the offering.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditing delivery of this proposal is relatively simple. It would be good so see more ambitious targets for success however. What would it mean for the participants who received the training? How would in impact their businesses? How much impact would it have on the Catalyst ecosystem as a whole?

f6_assessments.q0: While Intellectual Property Training might be interesting for some entrepreneurs, it's still only one of the multiple areas which are important these days. And your proposed budget is almost equal to the whole budget of the challenge! Of course it's important to sell your services, but I would suggest you to start with a smaller requested amount, you will have more chances this way.
f6_assessments.q1: Entrepreneurs in the Cardano ecosystem need to have multiple skills, and in the age of open source software it's highly doubtful that such training are the ones entrepreneurs need to start with. Your proposal proposes to take the whole budget of the challenge and most probably it won't happen.
f6_assessments.q2: Most entrepreneurs are interested in creating value, and creating intellectual property. At the early stage there is no need in IP Audits as there is not so much IP created. It will be really hard to evaluate the success of such training, especially taking into account the high price.

f6_assessments.q0:
The solution helps early stage entrepreneur develop their skills in intellectual property rights which is a relevant skill however the solution is specific to a subset of countries and takes the form of 10 training sessions with a subset of students receiving IP audits so it does not scale to the general community. 
Based upon my experience, I strongly disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The budget for this proposal is $147K of the $150K which effectively would make it the only proposal selected and it does not meet the challenge objective which makes the budget unreasonable.
Based upon my experience, I neither agree nor disagree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides a roadmap with auditable milestones and a defined timeline. 
Based upon my experience, I agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal has good value but fails to specify the execution of it, leaving the audience to assume how it will be used by the Catalyst community of entrepreneurs. Ie. Are the courses free? And Is it specifically targeted to the Catalyst Community? If so, then this proposal definitely addresses the challenge, especially because it helps shed light on topics that are not normally known or explored by many proposers.

I have asked for more information in the comments, and hope that the answers the proposer provides will help better shape their future assessments.
f6_assessments.q1:
I believe the team has the expertise required to build and deliver. However, I am concerned with costs. The proposal fails to list cost's breakdowns. How is it all being used? Ie. If a proposer in Brazil takes the course but requires local assistance or support on the IP/IA areas of their project, is this proposal addressing costs associated with that as well? Or are the 6K GBP used only for program production, and infrastructure costs? What's included in the 6k GBP per program?

I have asked for more information in the comments, and hope that the answers the proposer provides will help better shape their future assessments.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are no strong KPIs listed in the proposal, thar area was left quite vague. In order to assess progression, one would have to derive KPIs from their proposal, or ask for more information.

I believe that overall the proposal could be improved to provide a bit more clarity in certain areas.

solution: Deliver IP training and other IP consultancy services to entrepreneurs to assist them to commercialise their IP.
experience: Our consulting team has decades of experience delivering IP training to early stage innovators both in UK and internationally.
